titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Eleanor Heist Slifer (1900-1986) was an entomologist at the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia. Slifer received her Masters and Ph.D. degrees from the University of Pennsylvania (in 1926 and 1930, respectively). She taught for a time at Temple University and then was a professor at the University of Iowa until 1963, when she returned to Philadelphia to join the Academy as a as a research fellow in the Department of Entomology. Her research interests were insect anatomy, physiology, development, genetics, behavior, and especially sense organs (chemoreceptors).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Eleanor Slifer. Materials include: research notes, many including anatomical sketches; illustrations, photographs, negatives, and contact sheets; and manuscript and typescript drafts, galleys, and several reprints. The collection also includes a bibliography of Slifer's published works.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
